content.content:
When the charm of Rio de Janeiro meets the best of Brazilian design, the result is a home with identity, warmth, and authenticity. Influencer Silvia Braz's new apartment embodies this encounter: an ode to beachside lifestyle with a sophisticated soul, where every detail speaks of style, affection, and Brazilian essence.


Designed by Sig Bergamin and Murilo Lomas, the project blends tropical references with vibrant colors, striking textures, and a sensitive eye for authentic Brazilian design. At the heart of this setting, Breton stands out with pieces that elegantly reflect the spirit of the home and its resident.

Silvia chose a home as warm as it is full of personality. Breton made its mark in several spaces with furniture that, beyond refined aesthetics, invites conviviality and well-being.


The Pilotis bar, created by Bruno Niz, for example, is one of the living room highlights. With its fluid geometry and impeccable finish, it embodies the laid-back carioca vibe without sacrificing sophistication.

In the bedroom, the bed, nightstands, and Joá line bench, designed by Giácomo Tomazzi, offer a welcoming atmosphere with the ancestral technique of woven straw. The organic volumes, natural tones, and artisanal touch reinforce the urban refuge feel.

The social area also features the Floripa dining table by designer Luisa Moysés, which stands out with lightness and presence thanks to its marble top. Ideal for a contemporary proposal that defines the new Brazilian way of living.
